1.verse: The Judgment Is Near -Judgment of the Nations -Chapter 1 -Title and Introduction. -These are the words of Amos, a shepherd of Tekoa, concerning visions in regard to Israel during the reigns of Uzziah, king of Judah, and Jeroboam, son of Joash, king of Israel, two years prior to the earthquake.

2.verse: He said:“The Lord roars from Zion,and his name thunders forth from Jerusalem.The pastures of the shepherds will witherand the summit of Carmel will be arid.”

3.verse: For Three Crimes of Damascus -These are the words of the Lord:For three crimes of Damascus, and for four,I will not revoke my decree.Because they threshed Gileadwith threshing-sledges of iron,

4.verse: I will send fire on the house of Hazael,and it will devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.

5.verse: I will demolish the gate bars of Damascusand destroy the inhabitants in the Valley of Aven,as well as the sceptered ruler of Beth-eden;the people of Aram will be exiled to Kir,says the Lord.

6.verse: For Three Crimes of Gaza -Thus says the Lord:For three crimes of Gaza, and for four,I will not revoke my decree.Because they deported entire communitiesand sent them in exile to Edom,

7.verse: I will send fire down on the walls of Gazato devour its palaces.

8.verse: I will destroy the inhabitants of Ashdodand the sceptered ruler at Ashkelon.I will turn my hand against Ekron,and the remnant of the Philistines will perish,says the Lord God.

9.verse: For Three Crimes of Tyre -Thus says the Lord:For three crimes of Tyre, and for four,I will not revoke my decree.Because they delivered entire communities to slavery in Edomand ignored the covenant of brotherhood,

10.verse: I will send fire down on the walls of Tyreto devour its palaces.

11.verse: For Three Crimes of Edom -Thus says the Lord:For three crimes of Edom, and for four,I will not revoke my decree.Because he pursued his brother with the swordand stifled any semblance of pity,because he was unceasing in his angerand constantly nurtured his wrath,

12.verse: I will send down fire on Temanto devour the palaces of Bozrah.

13.verse: For Three Crimes of Ammon -Thus says the Lord:For three crimes of the Ammonites, and for four,I will not revoke my decree.Because they ripped open the pregnant women in Gileadin their determination to enlarge their territory,

14.verse: I will send down fire upon the walls of Rabbahto devour its palacesamid war cries on the day of battleand violent storms on the day of the whirlwind.

15.verse: Then their king will go into exile,accompanied by his chief advisors,says the Lord.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -For Three Crimes of Moab -Thus says the Lord:For three crimes of Moab, and for four,I will not revoke my decree.Because they incinerated to ashesthe bones of the king of Edom,

2.verse: I will send down fire on Moabto devour the palaces of Kerioth.Moab will perish amid the uproar,amid war cries and the sound of trumpets.

3.verse: I will destroy its rulersand slaughter all of his officials with him.

4.verse: For Three Crimes of Judah -Thus says the Lord:For three crimes of Judah, and for four,I will not revoke my decree.Because they have spurned the law of the Lordand have not observed his statutes,having been led astrayby the lies which their fathers followed,

5.verse: I will send fire down on Judahto devour the palaces of Jerusalem.

6.verse: The Trial of Israel -For Three Crimes of Israel -Thus says the Lord:For three crimes of Israel, and for four,I will not revoke my decree.They sell righteous people for silverand the poor for a pair of sandals.

7.verse: They have trampled the heads of the poorinto the dust of the earthand thrust the lowly out of their way.Father and son lie with the same prostitute,profaning my holy name.

8.verse: They lie down beside every altarupon garments acquired as surety,while drinking in the house of their Godthe wine purchased with the fines they impose.

9.verse: Yet I was the onewho destroyed the Amorites before them;they were as tall as the cedarsand as strong as the oaks.I was the onewho destroyed their fruit aboveand their roots below.

10.verse: I was the onewho brought you up from the land of Egyptand for forty years led you through the desertto take possession of the land of the Amorites.

11.verse: I was the onewho raised up some of your sons to be prophetsand some of your young men to be Nazirites.Is this not indeed true, O Israelites?says the Lord.

12.verse: But you forced the Nazirites to drink wineand commanded the prophets, “Do not prophesy!”

13.verse: Therefore, I will crush youjust as a cart crushes when it is fully laden.

14.verse: The swift will be unable to take flight;the strong man will not retain his strength,and the warrior will be unable to save his life.

15.verse: The archer will not stand his ground;the swift of foot will not escape,nor will the horseman save his life.

16.verse: Even the bravest of warriorswill flee away naked on that day,says the Lord.

1.verse: Charges against Israel -Chapter 3 -The First Word. -O men of Israel, hear this word that the Lord has spoken against you, against the whole family that I brought up out of the land of Egypt:

2.verse: Of all the families of the earth,you alone have I favored.That is why I will punish youfor all your iniquities.

3.verse: The Lord Speaks: Who Would Not Prophesy? -Do two people travel togetherunless they have first agreed to do so?

4.verse: Does a lion roar in the forestwhen it has no prey?Does a young lion cry out from its denunless it has caught something?

5.verse: Does a bird fall into a snare on the earthunless a trap has been set for it?Does a snare spring up from the groundunless something has been caught in it?

6.verse: Are people not alarmedif a trumpet sounds in the city?If disaster strikes a city,can that occur without the approval of the Lord?

7.verse: Indeed, the Lord God does nothingwithout revealing his planto his servants, the prophets.

8.verse: The lion roars;who will not be frightened?The Lord God has spoken;who will not prophesy?

9.verse: Violence and Pillage in Their Palace -Proclaim this from thepalaces of Ashdodand from the palaces of the land of Egypt:“Assemble on the hills of Samariaand observe the great disorders there,as well as the oppression in her midst.”

10.verse: For they do not know how to do what is right,says the Lord,as they store up in their palacestheir ill-gotten gains from violence and robbery.

11.verse: Therefore, this is what the Lord God has to say:An enemy shall surround your land;he will tear down your strongholdsand pillage your palaces.

12.verse: The Lord says further:As the shepherd rescues from the jaws of a liontwo legs or the tip of an ear,so will the Israelites who live in Samaria be rescuedwith the corner of a couch or the edge of a cot.

13.verse: I Will Deal with the Altars of Bethel -Listen and testify against the house of Jacob, says the Lord God, the God of hosts:

14.verse: On the day when I punish Israel for its crimes,I will also deal with the altars of Bethel:the horns of the altar shall be hacked offand fall to the ground.

15.verse: I shall destroy the winter houseas well as the summer house.The houses of ivory will perish,and many mansions will be no more,says the Lord.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -The Second Word -Listen to this warning, you cows of Bashan,you women who dwell on the mount of Samaria,you who oppress the weak and crush the needy,who command your husbands, “Bring us something to drink!”

2.verse: The Lord God has sworn by his holiness:The time is surely coming upon youwhen you will be dragged away with hooks,and the last of you with fishhooks.

3.verse: Through breaches in the wall you will leaveeach one straight ahead,and you shall be flung out atop a dungheap,says the Lord.

4.verse: Run to Your Sanctuary -Come to Bethel and sin!Come to Gilgal and sin even more!Bring your sacrifices every morning,your tithes every third day.

5.verse: Burn your thank offering of leavened bread,and brag publicly about your free-will offerings.For this is what you love to do,O children of Israel, says the Lord God.

6.verse: You Have Not Come to Me -Although I made your teethclean of food in all your citiesand spread famine in all your villages,you still would not return to me, says the Lord.

7.verse: I even withheld the rain from youwhen there were still three months before the harvest.I would allow rain to fall upon one townbut not upon another.One field would be watered by rain,while another would receive none and dry up.

8.verse: People from two or three townswould stagger to a neighboring town to drink water,yet their thirst remained unquenched.Yet even then you would not return to me,says the Lord.

9.verse: I struck you with mildew and blight,I laid waste your gardens and vineyards;the locust devoured your fig trees and your olive trees,but still you would not return to me,says the Lord.

10.verse: I sent among you a plague like that of Egypt,and I slaughtered your young men with the sword.I allowed your horses to be captured;I filled your nostrils with the stench of your camps.And still you would not return to me,says the Lord.

11.verse: I brought destruction among youlike that which devastated Sodom and Gomorrah.You were like a brand snatched from the fire,and still you would not come back to me,says the Lord.

12.verse: Therefore, O Israel,this is what I plan to do with you.And because I intend to do this,prepare to meet your God, O Israel.

13.verse: Homage to the Lord -He is the one who formed the mountainsand created the wind,and who reveals to men his thoughts,who changes the dawn into darknessand strides upon the heights of the earth:the Lord, the God of hosts, is his name.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -Funereal Chant -Listen to these words that I utter against you in lamentation, O house of Israel:

2.verse: She has fallen, to rise no more,the virgin Israel.She lies forsaken on her own soil,with no one to raise her up.

3.verse: For thus says the Lord God:The city that marched out to war with a thousandwill be left with a hundred;and the one that marched out with a hundredwill have only ten left.Seek the Lord and Live. -

4.verse: For thus says the Lord to the house of Israel:If you seek me, you will survive,

5.verse: but do not go to Bethel.Do not journey to Gilgal,and do not cross over to Beer-sheba.For Gilgal will surely be led into exile,and Bethel shall come to nothing.

6.verse: Seek the Lord and you will live,or else, like a fire,he will sweep through the house of Joseph,with no one able to quench the flames.

7.verse: Woe to those who turn justice to wormwoodand thrust righteousness to the ground.

8.verse: Hymn to God the Creator -He who made the Pleiades and Orion,who turns heavy darkness into dawnand darkens day into night,who summons the waters of the seaand pours them out over the surface of the earth,

9.verse: who brings destruction on the strongand ruin upon the fortress:the Lord is his name.

10.verse: Because You Crush the Weak -They hate the one who preaches justice at the city gateand abhor the one who speaks the truth.

11.verse: Therefore, because you have trampled upon the poorand extorted levies on their wheat,even though you have built houses of hewn stone,you will never live in them;although you have planted pleasant vineyards,you will never drink their wine.

12.verse: For I know how many are your crimesand how monstrous are your sins.You oppress the innocent, accept bribes,and push aside the destitute at the gates.

13.verse: Therefore, the prudent man keeps silent in such a situation,for it is an evil period.

14.verse: Seek the Good So That You Will Live -Seek good and not evil,so that you may live.Then the Lord, the God of hosts, will be with youas you claim he is.

15.verse: Hate evil and love good,and let justice prevail at the city gate.Then it is possible that the Lord, the God of hosts,will show mercy to the remnant of Joseph.

16.verse: The Countryside Is Devastated. -Therefore, this is what the Lord, the God of hosts, the Almighty, has to say:In every public square there will be lamentation;in every street they will cry out, “Alas! Alas!”They will summon the farmers to wail,and the professional mourners to lament.

17.verse: There will be wailing in every vineyard,for I will pass through your midst,says the Lord.

18.verse: Woe to those who long for the day of the Lord.What will this day of the Lord mean to you?It will mean darkness, not light,

19.verse: as if someone fled from a lionand was met by a bear,or entered his houseand rested his hand against the walland was bitten by a snake.

20.verse: Will not the day of the Lordbe darkness, not light,day of gloom without any brightness?

21.verse: I Despise Your Feasts -I loathe, I despise your festivals,and I take no delight in your solemn assemblies.

22.verse: Even though you bring meyour burnt offerings and your grain offerings,I will not accept them.Nor will I look favorablyupon your stall-fed peace offerings.

23.verse: Spare me the noise of your chanting;I will not listen to the melodies of your harps.

24.verse: Rather, let justice flow like a river,and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.

25.verse: Did you bring me sacrifices and offeringsduring those forty years in the desert,O house of Israel?

26.verse: You have lifted up Sakuth, your king,and Kaiwan, your star god,the images that you have made for yourselves.

27.verse: Therefore, I will drive you into exile beyond Damascus,says the Lord, whose name is the God of hosts.

1.verse: Chapter 6 -Bloody Description of the Orgy of the Head of Israel -Alas for those who are at ease in Zion,and for those who feel secure on the mount of Samaria,the leaders of the most important of the nationsto whom the people of Israel have recourse.

2.verse: Cross over to Calneh and see;travel on from there to Hamath the great,and then go down to Gath of the Philistines.Are you better than these kingdoms?Is your territory greater than theirs?

3.verse: You put aside all thoughts of the evil dayand thereby hasten the reign of violence.

4.verse: Alas for those who lie on beds of ivoryand lounge on their couches.They feast on lambs from the flockand stall-fattened calves.

5.verse: They improvise on the music of the harp,and, like David, they invent musical instruments.

6.verse: They drink wine by the bowlfuland anoint themselves with the finest oils,but they feel no grief over the ruin of Joseph.

7.verse: Therefore, they will now be the first to go into exile,and their wanton revelry will come to an end.

8.verse: There Will Be Nothing Left of Israel -The Lord God has sworn by himself.Thus say I, the Lord, the God of hosts:I abhor the pride of Jacoband hate his palaces,I shall deliver up the cityand all that is in it.

9.verse: If ten men are left in a single house,they will die.

10.verse: Only a few will be leftto carry out the dead from the house.If someone calls to a man inside the house,“Are there any more there?”and he answers, “No,”then he will say, “Hush,”for the name of the Lord must not be mentioned.

11.verse: At the Lord’s command,the great house will be shattered to bits,and the small houses will be reduced to rubble.

12.verse: Can horses gallop over rocks?Can one plow the sea with oxen?Yet you have turned justice into poisonand the fruit of justice into venom—

13.verse: you who rejoice in Lodebar,who say, “Have we not, by our own strength,seized Karnaim for ourselves?”

14.verse: Beware, O house of Israel,for I am raising up against you a nation,says the Lord, the God of hosts,and that nation shall oppress youfrom Lebo of Hamath even to the Wadi Arabah.

1.verse: Visions: Amos, Confidant of God -Chapter 7 -The Vision of Locusts. -This is what the Lord God showed me: he was forming a swarm of locusts after the king’s share had been harvested and the second growth was beginning to sprout.

2.verse: When the locusts had finished eating all the grass in the land, I said:Lord God, forgive, I beg you.Jacob is so small;how can he survive?

3.verse: Thereupon the Lord relented. “This shall not happen,” said the Lord God.

4.verse: The Vision of Fire. -This is what the Lord God then showed me: the Lord God was summoning a fire of judgment to devour the great abyss and to consume the land.

5.verse: I said:Lord God, cease, I beg you.Jacob is so small;how can he survive?

6.verse: Thereupon the Lord relented. “This also shall not happen,” said the Lord God.

7.verse: The Vision of the Plumb Line. -Then the Lord showed me this: he was standing by a wall, with a plumb line in his hand.

8.verse: The Lord asked me, “What do you see, Amos?” I replied, “A plumb line.” Then the Lord said:Behold, I am setting a plumb linein the midst of my people Israel;never again will I forgive their offenses.

9.verse: The high places of Isaac shall be laid waste,and the sanctuaries of Israel will be left desolate;with sword in handI will rise against the house of Jeroboam.

10.verse: Amos Expelled by the Priests of Bethel. -Then Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent the following message to Jeroboam, the king of Israel: “Amos has conspired against you here in the heart of the house of Israel, and the country cannot tolerate his message.

11.verse: For this is what Amos is saying:“ ‘Jeroboam will die by the sword,and the Israelites will be taken into captivity,far away from their native land.’ ”

12.verse: To Amos himself Amaziah said, “Go, O seer, and flee to the land of Judah. There you can prophesy and earn your living.

13.verse: But never again prophesy at Bethel, for this is the king’s sanctuary and a royal shrine.”

14.verse: Amos replied to Amaziah, “I am not a prophet, nor a prophet’s son. I was a shepherd and a dresser of sycamore-fig trees.

15.verse: But the Lord took me away from tending the flock and said to me, ‘Go forth and prophesy to my people Israel.’

16.verse: So now, listen to the word of the Lord. You tell me that I am not to prophesy against Israel or to preach against the house of Isaac.

17.verse: Therefore, thus says the Lord:“ ‘Your wife will become a prostitute in the city,and your sons and daughters will fall by the sword.Your land will be parceled out by a measuring line;you yourself will die in a pagan country,and Israel will be deported in captivityfar from its native land.’ ”

1.verse: Chapter 8 -The Vision of the Fruit Basket. -This is what the Lord God showed me: a basket of ripe fruit.

2.verse: He asked, “What do you see, Amos?” I replied, “A basket of ripe fruit.” Then the Lord said to me:The time is ripe for my people Israel;I will never again pardon their offenses.

3.verse: The songs of the temple shall become wailings on that day;there will be corpses strewn everywhere.Be silent! Thus says the Lord God.

4.verse: Listen, You Who Crush the Poor -Hear this, you who crush the needyand trample upon the poor of the land.

5.verse: “When will the new moon be over,” you ask,“so that we may sell our grain,and the Sabbath,so that we may market our wheat?Then we can make the bushel measure smallerand increase the shekel-weightby adjusting the scales fraudulently.

6.verse: We can buy the poor man for silverand the needy for a pair of sandals;we can even sell the refuse of the wheat.”

7.verse: The Lord has sworn by the pride of Jacob:Never will I forget any of their deeds.

8.verse: Will not the land tremble because of this?Will not everyone mourn who dwells in it?The whole earth will rise like the Nile,swelling and then subsidinglike the River of Egypt.

9.verse: I Will Turn Your Feasts into Mourning -On that day, says the Lord God,I will make the sun go down at noonand darken the earth in broad daylight.

10.verse: I will turn your feasts into mourning,and all your songs into lamentation.I will make you cover your loins with sackclothand shave your heads.I will make it like mourning for an only sonand the end of it like a bitter day.

11.verse: The days are surely coming, says the Lord God,when I will send a famine upon the land,not a hunger for bread or a thirst for water,but for hearing the word of the Lord.

12.verse: People will stagger from sea to seaand wander from north to east,in search of the word of the Lord,but they will not find it.

13.verse: On that day, fair maidens and young menwill faint from thirst.

14.verse: Those who swear by the shameful idol of Samariaand say, “As your god lives, O Dan,”and, “By the sacred path to Beer-sheba,”will all fall and never rise again.

1.verse: Chapter 9 -The Vision of the Destroyed Sanctuary. -I saw the Lord standing beside the altar, and he said:Strike the tops of the pillars until the thresholds shake,and bring them down on the heads of all the people.Should any survive,I will slay them with the sword.Not one will be able to flee;not one will escape.

2.verse: Even should they dig down to the netherworld,from there my hand will take them.Even though they climb up to heaven,I will bring them down.

3.verse: Should they hide themselves on the summit of Carmel,there I will track them down and take them.Should they hide from my sight at the bottom of the sea,I will command the serpent there to bite them.

4.verse: If they are led by their enemies into captivity,there I shall command the sword to slay them.I will fix my eyes on themfor evil, and not for good.

5.verse: Psalm of Praise -The Lord, the God of hosts,touches the earth and it meltsso that all who live on it mourn,while the entire earth rises up like the Nileand then subsides like the River of Egypt.

6.verse: He builds his upper chambers in the heavensand establishes his vault of the sky over the earth—the Lord is his name.

7.verse: The Lord says:Are you not like the Ethiopians to me,O people of Israel?Did I not bring Israel up from the land of Egypt,and the Philistines from Caphtor,and the Arameans from Kir?

8.verse: Behold, I, the Lord God,have my eyes upon this sinful kingdom,and I will destroy it from the face of the earth.The Time of Renewal -I Will Raise Up the Hut of David -However, I will not completely destroy the house of Jacob,says the Lord.

9.verse: For I will give the commandand shake out the house of Israelfrom among all the nations,as one sifts with a sievewithout one pebble falling to the ground.

10.verse: All the sinners among my people shall die by the sword,those who say, “Evil will not approach or overtake us.”

11.verse: On that day I shall raise upthe fallen hut of David.I will repair the gaps in its walls,restore its ruins,and rebuild it as in the days of old,

12.verse: so that Israel may possess the remnant of Edomand of all the nations that bear my name;I, the Lord, will accomplish this.

13.verse: I Will Reestablish My People Israel -The days are surely coming,says the Lord,when the plowman shall overtakethe one who reaps,and the treader of grapes will overtakethe one who sows the seed.New wine will drip from the mountains,and every hill will flow with it.

14.verse: I will restore the fortunes of my people Israel;they will rebuild the ruined cities and inhabit them.They will plant vineyards and drink their wine,cultivate gardens and eat their fruit.

15.verse: I will plant them in their own soil,and they shall never again be uprootedfrom the land I have given them.This is the word of the Lord, your God.
